column5: Lately I've been fishing the tribs a few times a week but never had more than a few hours including driving time... Today I had a full day so my leash was lengthened for the day.  I have had some successes this year but it has been a lot of smaller 1-3 lb fish. The tribs were REALLY low and clear in most cases so we guessed a river that might still produce. We apparently chose wisely.  River level slowly rose throughout the day... Colour remained gin clear. Missed some real good fish that I couldn't even turn in the big flows... Here's some pics I took of our rainy successes...  Early a.m. chrome   Releasing a chromedome   Nice chubby hen   Steel in the mist..   War vet.   Rosey Cheeks McGee   Thanks for reading!

Whoa, whoa whoa!  You've only been married for...what?  A few months?  And you're already making with the "leash" talk?!?    Nice report man....every time I see the reports from those Superior Tribs it makes me wanna drop everything and drive up there!!
i was on a leash long before i was married!  she had me the day she said "Dear, can you move those fishing rods out of the closets and put them in the shed where they belong"...
Nice ones!   If you think that your leash is short now, wait until kids come along!!!
hahah Mason! nice ones man, I need to go up with you one day this week.
I have a son.  He's WHY I have the leash. But I'm hoping that he will learn to love fishing early.
Nice steelies Dr.S....keep em coming....  TDunn
Great report and pics Dr. S Got to love it when you can spend a whole day out there!!! Nice steel for sure Thanks for sharing Leechman
I know that spot!!!!  Nice fish
Nice steeliesand great report. I think I packed it in too soon.

Good job, it was undoubtably an early morning if you go up there at that time.  Nice fish. In the future when taking a picture of wing and a fish focus more on the fish, by more I mean all on the fish.
Lucas,  Just checked out your blog...nice job! Looking forward to the site.
it's coming along slow and steady. just working on purchasing an HD cam for video purposes...
lets just not divulge too much about the park...i dont want to have to revoke your privilages for this area
Agreed, no names or signs...obatanga is too nice a park to have the fishing ruined.

i have no locations in my reports...and most of my pictures have no background... and this has nothing to do with any parks; obatanga or otherwise.  i just don't like people knowing where i fish and there's only 4 or 5 people i ever divulge location details to.
Bow your head in shame young man
hahaha!
Break those chains man... don't let the woman get a brutha down.  Catch feesh or die!!!
Beauties all around! Wish I had done more Steelhead fishing when I lived up on Superior. Thanks for sharing.
Very nice. Ontario and Quebec are truly blessed with some great fishing. Thanks for sharing.
